intro: Mariosousa willardiana, commonly known as the Willard's mariosousa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy soils with ample sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
